page.title: 10WAVERTON-THEN AND WARTON-NOW
page.content: Waverton is mentioned soon after the Norman Conquest as being the desmesne of the Abbey at Polesworthalthough it is almost certain to of existed much earlier.Robert Marmion of Tamworth gave the land to the nuns of {Polesworth Abbey}in the 12th Century. In the 15th Century,Warton was also called the manor of Stiper hill and 3 weekly courts were held here.The { {housing}in the village consists of council houses and privately owned property.The{employment}in the area is diverse,{mining,}farming, the service industries,self employed and professional.The survey shows 67 Non manual workers,34 manual workers with 44 retired or unemployed.Just less than half of these travel more than 10 miles to work. Half the houses are less than 20 years old with coal being the main source of fuel.
